intro: Disterigma elassanthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved disterigma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
